settlement  before  the  District  Court  of  Nawalapitiya  the  terms  of  which
are,
(i)  The  plaintiff  agrees  to  withdraw  the  plaint  ant  to  grant  the  1st
respondent the reliefs in paragraphs (b) and (c) of the prayer to the
Answer, that is,
(b) for a declaration that the 1st respondent is entitled to the lawful
possession of the premises and
(c) for a permanent injunction against the petitioner restraining her
from disturbing that possession  (according to “Y. 45”)
(ii) The 01st respondent to pay the petitioner a sum of Rs. 3,250,000/-

the  settlement  is  a  fraud  practiced  on  her  rights.  Hence  she  prays  for
Restitutio in Integrum and or Revision.
